DataElement.preferredDefinition: the first date of an assessment of progression of Prostate Specific Antigen (alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family)) at progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the first occurrence or date of prostate speecific antigen (Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family)) progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI):Progression; advancement in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.
Progression; advancement in extent or severity.
